sub_title: Sustainable & Rural Development | Program Management | Business Development
summary:
I am a Brazilian Forest Engineer and Lawyer, who came to the Netherlands for a master’s degree in Development Studies. I took the Major in Agrarian, Food and Environmental Studies, because it connected both of my backgrounds, combining political sciences with the management of natural resources.

I have a diverse set of professional experiences. Throughout my career I was given different roles and developed a wide range of expertise from operational, commercial, and business development fields, to project management and technical analysis (GIS; land regularization and social cadaster; topography; forest surveys; Environmental and Social Impact Assessments; and so forth). But among all things I've done what I like the most is connecting with people and institutions, creating synergies regardless of the position title or the project I was working with. 

I strive in collaborative environments, coordinating teams, negotiating to reach common ground, building relationships to foster intersectional interests, and liaising with internal and external stakeholders – apart from my solid environmental background. To apply those skills in favor of sustainable development initiatives is my purpose and passion. My philosophy is: ‘do what you love, with presence and energy and generate positive impact’.

With an entrepreneurial focus and due to my system thinking mindset, I developed an innovative and sustainable business model targeting ecosystem services and forest offsets at the Brazilian Atlantic Rainforest (a UNESCO Biosphere Reserve), adding value to my clients’ strategy while mitigating environmental impacts of deforestation and ensuring economic value for a preserved piece of tropical forest. This initiative was recognized amongst the Best Practices on Natural Capital Business Management in a national wide call of cases promoted by Fundacao Getulio Vargas (FGV), a Brazilian think tank.

awards.title: Best Practices on Natural Capital Business Management
awards.description:
The call for cases on Natural Capital Business Management is a pioneering initiative in Brazil. It started from a partnership between the Ministry of the Environment (MMA), the National Confederation of Industries (CNI), and the German Cooperation for Sustainable Development (GIZ), under the TEEB Regional-Local Project, with the Center for Sustainability Studies at Getúlio Vargas Foundation (FGVces), and it was also supported by the Boticario Group Foundation.
The business model I've created consists of an innovative initiative targeting tropical forest offsets, adding value to my clients’ strategy while mitigating deforestation impacts and ensuring economic value for a preserved piece of tropical forest. I was pleased to be recognized amongst the 16 selected cases that showed how the management of natural capital creates value for companies and, at the same time, for the ecosystems they are part of. 

link to the publication: http://www.p22on.com.br/en/2018/10/02/transacoes-naturais/

projects.title: ARKA - Environmental and clean energy solutions
projects.description:
Working as an independent, outsourced Business developer (collaborator), my role was 
to promote the ARKA solutions through strategic partnerships. The objective of the ARKA project is to develop technical solutions to reduce the sugarcane wastewater impacts (vinhaça) while generating positive energy outputs, contributing to improving the energy-water-nexus of sugarcane production systems on regional scales. The Project contributes directly creating balances and synergies among different Sustainable Development Goals, such as SDG 6 "Clean Water and Sanitation" and SDG 7 "Affordable and Clean Energy".

profile_positions.title: Partnership Manager

profile_positions.description:
- Facilitate partnerships and coalitions, including with governments, development partners, civil society organizations,  industry associations,  development finance, research centers, and the private sector.
- Attracting impact investments for climate resilience projects as and when required.
- Collaborate in the design and set up of new projects and initiatives for the program.
- Lead proposal development, writing of concept and brief notes, and program summaries as required to support the growth of the program and reporting to donors.
- Manage partnerships with Implementing Partners' team, and support Monitoring & Evaluation.
- Contribute actively to strategic multi-year plans, annual reports, and roadmap development aligned with the organization's ambition and market trends.
- Support knowledge management, identifying learning opportunities related to sustainable business models, market developments, and trends within the agricultural sector, especially in the textile industry (cotton).
profile_positions.title: Program Manager - Climate-smart Cotton Landscapes

profile_positions.description:
- Develop and execute strategies to address company growth & business development from drafting plans to contracting and customer relations/CRM.
- Researching environmental sustainability issues, coordinating projects related to regenerative agroforestry, and general project management.
- Creating methodologies to assess the viability or success of sustainability initiatives via plans, metrics, and targets with the selected business areas towards a low carbon and inclusive economy.
- Management of sustainability data and KPI dashboard development for executive levels and external stakeholders.
- Evaluate and approve proposals for sustainable supply chains, considering factors such as cost-effectiveness, technical feasibility, and integration with other initiatives. 
- Business development: pipeline management, expanding to new business opportunities (products and consultancy services), and partnership building. Exploring new funding opportunities within sustainable finance and carbon markets.
- Support team leadership & resource management.
profile_positions.title: Latam Portfolio Manager - Agroforestry

profile_positions.description:
Promotion of Florestec's innovative business model targeting ecosystem services at the Atlantic Rainforest (a UNESCO Biosphere Reserve). This is done adding value to our clients’ strategy while mitigating the environmental impacts of deforestation and ensuring economic value for preserved patches of tropical forest. 

The solution is implemented through environmental easement contracts either in farmland already owned by the company or creating opportunities for smallholder farmers with forest surplus according to the Brazilian forest code. 

This initiative was recognized amongst the Best Practices on Natural Capital Business Management in a national wide call of cases promoted by Fundacao Getulio Vargas (FGV), a Brazilian think tank.

company.name: International Institute of Social Studies (ISS) of Erasmus University Rotterdam

profile_positions.company: International Institute of Social Studies (ISS) of Erasmus University Rotterdam
profile_positions.description:
Agrarian, Food and Environmental Studies (AFES) offers an interdisciplinary approach – combining political economy, political ecology, and political sociology – to understanding and confronting the impacts of global capitalist development on agrarian structures and environmental systems.

The focus of the AFES Major is on the social, political and economic dynamics of rural and agrarian change and environmental degradation, seen from a wider perspective of rural and rural-urban links, and across the Global South-North divides to include emerging international actors in agro-environmental terrain, such as BRICS.
profile_positions.title: Master Student

company.name: iClima - Instituto Brasileiro para o Direito das Mudanças Climáticas

profile_positions.company: iClima - Instituto Brasileiro para o Direito das Mudanças Climáticas
profile_positions.description: The objective of the Institute is to contribute and promote Brazilian initiatives that comply with the global climate change agreement and to monitor its implementations by public agencies, private and third sector. My role was to establish the foundation settings and constitution document and to organize events, such as workshops, roundtables, and discussions in order to promote high-level debates with multidisciplinary professionals network composed by governmental officers, entrepreneurs, civil society leaders, and academic researchers.
profile_positions.title: Member of the Board

profile_positions.description:
I was invited by my former Professor of Environmental Law to join him in opening this Law firm. We both had side projects: he was a University Professor, whereas I was ahead of the consulting company. Within Florestec I had positioned to focus on business-to-business relations, whereas in this law firm I was acting as a direct advisor focusing on individual interests in conflicting scenarios, such as farmers and rural landowners vs environmental rights. 

My role was to provide both technical and legal advice on how to comply with the complex Brazilian environmental regulation, in subjects like the Forest Code (Federal Law), Atlantic rainforest and Cerrado legislation, Environmental fines, and Environmental Crime.

Also, through strategic partnerships, I performed as an independent expert for third-party firms, in the preparation of legal statements and opinions related to environmental law, climate change, working conditions & labor rights, and social housing rights. 

A good part of my work was to conduct legal research, collect pieces of evidence, draft documents and to prepare clear analytical reports. As a Lawyer, I also presented cases in the court environment and had to logically follow up the selected strategy and to support argumentation during trial procedures.

I managed to successfully defend family farmers and rural producers in environmental criminal processes, mainly related to the occupation of wetlands and riparian areas, and harmful conduct against native forests and non-permitted occupation of protected sites, reaching fair environmental compensation measures through legal agreements supported by the Environmental Agency and Justice Departments.
profile_positions.title: Associate Lawyer

profile_positions.title: Technical Officer (Engineer Officer)

profile_positions.description:
·	General business administration, food production management, and customer service;
·	Application of Environmental, Health and Safety guidelines.

Smallholder rural company, dedicated to producing Shimejii Mushrooms in a peri-urban estate. My responsibilities were to manage the mushroom production, from seeding to harvesting and to develop new production technology to increase food productivity.

The production was relying on the use of glass pots to grow the mushrooms, and because of that, we faced some safety issues. For this reason, in order to reduce incidents, I started to research about alternative productions methods, and I discovered that polyurethane plastic bags could be a solution, but they took more time to be filled. Therefore, I designed a pneumatic machine to automatize the filing of bags. As a result, we reduced by zero the accident numbers and increased production by 15%.
profile_positions.title: Mushroom Production Manager

profile_positions.description:
Professional Environmental Training Program, with 250 hours, related to: Nature conservancy; Organization development; Project management; Human resources management.

Experience with innovative techniques to support and NGO management, and to comprehend the environmental situation at country level and establish strategies to develop solutions. Related subjects developed: Nature conservancy history; Panoramic view of environmental issues; Conservation units and parks systems of the world; Brazilian System compared to other countries; Project planning and  management; Environmental education and interpretation; Public use structures; Track planning and implementation; Ecotourism and recreational activities; Visitor management; International fund-raising.
